text: Hillbilly Elegy is an upcoming American drama film directed by Ron Howard, from a screenplay written by Vanessa Taylor, based on the memoir of the same name written by J.D. Vance. The film stars Amy Adams, Glenn Close, Gabriel Basso, Haley Bennett, Freida Pinto, Bo Hopkins, and Owen Asztalos. Hillbilly Elegy is scheduled to be released in select theaters and on Netflix on November 24, 2020. == Premise== The film is a modern exploration of the American Dream through three generations of an Appalachian family. ==Cast== * Amy Adams as Bev Vance * Glenn Close as Mamaw Vance * Gabriel Basso as J.D. Vance ** Owen Asztalos as Young J.D. * Haley Bennett * Freida Pinto * Bo Hopkins * William C. Ingram ==Production== Imagine Entertainment won the rights to the memoir in an April 2017 auction for Ron Howard to direct. In February 2018, Vanessa Taylor was set to adapt the novel into a screenplay. In March 2018, Ron Howard was spotted at the Buckingham Coal Mine near Corning, Ohio, scouting possible locations in Perry County. In October 2018 and March 2019, Howard was spotted in Middletown, Ohio, scouting filming locations. In January 2019, Netflix won the rights to the film after bidding $45 million on the project. Glenn Close, Amy Adams, Gabriel Basso and Haley Bennett joined the cast in April. In June 2019, Freida Pinto, Bo Hopkins and Owen Asztalos joined the cast. Principal photography began on June 12, 2019 in Atlanta, Georgia, and wrapped on August 8, 2019 in Middletown, Ohio, after having a 43-day shooting schedule. Although a few days of filming took place in the book's setting of Middletown, Ohio, much of the filming was done in Atlanta; Clayton, Georgia; and Macon, Georgia, using the production code-name "IVAN". Hans Zimmer and David Fleming will compose the film's music. With shooting complete, by January 2020 the film was in post-production. ==Release== The film is scheduled to be released on Netflix on November 24, 2020, after a theatrical run in select theaters. ==References== ==External links== * * Category:2020 films Category:2020 drama films Category:American films Category:American drama films Category:Films about families Category:Films based on biographies Category:Films directed by Ron Howard Category:Films produced by Brian Grazer Category:Films scored by Hans Zimmer Category:Films set in Ohio Category:Films shot in Atlanta Category:Films shot in Ohio Category:Imagine Entertainment films Category:Upcoming Netflix original films
